answer: Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine. Spread potatoes in an even, single layer.

query: where should I put the dish into? oven How do I prepare the potatoes for roasting? In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine. Spread potatoes in an even, single layer. what else do I need to season along with pepper? salt How long will the potatoes need to roast in the oven? Roast until a knife meets little resistance when inserted into a piece of potato, about 30 minutes how long do I cook this for? about 30 minutes what should I use to cut off the stem end of the tomatoes? sharp knife How should I properly prepare the tomatoes? Cut top 1/2 inch off stem end of tomatoes and set aside. Carefully run knife along the cavity of the tomato to loosen core and pulp, then use a spoon to carefully scoop them out into a bowl. What should I do with the tomato cores and pulp after I have scooped them out? Carefully scoop them out into a bowl. where do I put the tomato insides into? bowl what do I need to set aside now? tomatoes What should I do after I have scooped out the tomato cores and pulp? Season insides of tomatoes and their tops with salt, and place them upside down on wire rack set inside a rimmed baking sheet. Set tomatoes aside. what do I discard the seeds from? reserved tomato How should I prepare the tomato pulp? Using a food mill, pass reserved tomato pulp into a non-reactive container; discard seeds. What should I do if the volume of tomato pulp is less than 2 1/4 cups? If you don't have that much, add low-sodium chicken broth or vegetable stock to reach that volume. I don't have enough mixture what do I need to add to get the correct volume? broth what pulp do I need to put into the measuring cup? tomato What is the next step after heating the olive oil? Add shallots, season lightly with salt, and cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until shallots are softened but not browned, about 3 minutes. How can I prevent the shallots from browning? Cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until shallots are softened but not browned. what do I season the shallots with? salt What else should be soft as well as the shallots?
text: Relevant Information: salt Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Add shallots, season lightly with salt, and cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until shallots are softened but not browned, about 3 minutes. Step: 4. In a 3-quart stainless steel saucier, heat 1 tablespoon (15ml) olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add shallots, season lightly with salt, and cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until shallots are softened but not browned, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until garlic is softened as well, about 1 minute longer.

Spread potatoes in an even, single layer. what else do I need to season along with pepper? salt How long will the potatoes need to roast in the oven? Roast until a knife meets little resistance when inserted into a piece of potato, about 30 minutes how long do I cook this for? about 30 minutes what should I use to cut off the stem end of the tomatoes? sharp knife How should I properly prepare the tomatoes? Cut top 1/2 inch off stem end of tomatoes and set aside. Carefully run knife along the cavity of the tomato to loosen core and pulp, then use a spoon to carefully scoop them out into a bowl. What should I do with the tomato cores and pulp after I have scooped them out? Carefully scoop them out into a bowl. where do I put the tomato insides into? bowl what do I need to set aside now? tomatoes What should I do after I have scooped out the tomato cores and pulp? Season insides of tomatoes and their tops with salt, and place them upside down on wire rack set inside a rimmed baking sheet. Set tomatoes aside. what do I discard the seeds from? reserved tomato How should I prepare the tomato pulp? Using a food mill, pass reserved tomato pulp into a non-reactive container; discard seeds. What should I do if the volume of tomato pulp is less than 2 1/4 cups? If you don't have that much, add low-sodium chicken broth or vegetable stock to reach that volume. I don't have enough mixture what do I need to add to get the correct volume? broth what pulp do I need to put into the measuring cup? tomato What is the next step after heating the olive oil? Add shallots, season lightly with salt, and cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until shallots are softened but not browned, about 3 minutes. How can I prevent the shallots from browning? Cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until shallots are softened but not browned. what do I season the shallots with? salt What else should be soft as well as the shallots? garlic the shallots are now soft what should I add next? garlic Do I cook the garlic together with the shallots? Continue to cook, stirring frequently, until garlic is softened as well, about 1 minute longer. After the rice grains start to look like tiny ice cubes, what is the next step? Stir in tomato paste and continue to cook, stirring, until tomato paste evenly coats rice mixture and turns rust-colored, about 1 minute longer. what do I need to add in now to cook? rice what do I stir in after I've added the rice? <extra_id_0> Relevant Information: 165 g rice Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Add rice and cook, stirring, until rice is evenly coated in oil and toasted but not browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Step: 5. Add rice and cook, stirring, until rice is evenly coated in oil and toasted but not browned, 2 to 3 minutes. (Rice grains should start to look like tiny ice cubes: translucent around the edges and cloudy in the center.) Stir in tomato paste and continue to cook, stirring, until tomato paste evenly coats rice mixture and turns rust-colored, about 1 minute longer.

query: where should I put the dish into? oven How do I prepare the potatoes for roasting? In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine. Spread potatoes in an even, single layer. what else do I need to season along with pepper?
text: Relevant Information: pepper Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine. Step: 1. Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine. Spread potatoes in an even, single layer. Roast until a knife meets little resistance when inserted into a piece of potato, about 30 minutes. Set baking dish aside to cool; keep oven on.

query: what temperature should I preheat the oven to?
text: Relevant Information: to 400°F Information Type: temperature Instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Step: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

query: to what temperature should I preheat the oven? to 400°f What's next? Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. what do I need 2 tbsp of? olive oil what do I need sprigs of? sage In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash? toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt. Toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt. What should I do after cutting the squash? In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet. how long does it take until the diced squash is browned? about 30 minutes What is the indication that the squash trays are completely baked? Large chunks are very tender, about 45 minutes, and small diced squash is browned in spots, about 30 minutes. how long does it take until the chunks are very tender? about 45 minutes What should I do after the squash chunks have baked properly? Discard sage sprigs from large squash chunks. what do I discard the sage sprigs from? large squash what do I transfer the squash chunks, apple, and garlic cloves into? food processor, blender what do I transfer along with apple and garlic cloves? large squash How should I proceed after placing the squash, apple, and garlic into the food processor? Add miso and 1/4 cup (60ml) broth and blend until a smooth purée forms. What do I do once I have the puree ready? Season with salt. what do I season with? salt what heat setting should I use for the olive oil? medium-high heat How can I heat the olive oil properly in this step? Heat remaining 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil in a pressure cooker over medium-high heat until shimmering. what do I do to the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil? heat What should I do next with the onions after heating the olive oil? Add onion and cook, stirring, until translucent but not browned, about 4 minutes. what do I add after heating the olive oil? onion how long should I cook the rice? 3 to 4 minutes what do I add to cook? rice what should be evenly coated in oil? rice How can I tell if the rice is toasted properly? Rice grains should start to look like tiny ice cubes: translucent around the edges and cloudy in the center. how long should the wine take to fully evaporate? about 2 minutes what do I add into the rice? wine what is the smell that should be gone? raw alcohol what should I scrape the grains of? rice what should I scrape off the side of the pressure cooker besides rice? onion What should I do after adding the remaining broth? Scrape any grains of rice or pieces of onion from side of pressure cooker so that they are fully submerged. Close pressure cooker and bring up to low pressure (10 psi on most units). what should I stir in the remaining of? broth what heat setting should I melt the butter over? medium-high heat How do I know when the butter and sage are ready to be removed from heat? Until milk solids in butter turn a hazelnut-brown color, 1 to 2 minutes longer. how long should I wait for it to cook? 2 minutes What do I do with the sage leaves once they are fried? Using a slotted spoon, transfer sage leaves to a paper towel–lined plate. What should happen after stirring the rice and cooking liquid? It should begin to develop a creamy consistency. what puree should I stir in? squash what do I stir in next? brown butter What should I do if my risotto is too soupy?
text: Relevant Information: minutes Information Type: time Instruction: If risotto is too soupy, cook for a few minutes longer, stirring, until it begins to thicken more; it should look like a smooth, creamy sauce. Step: 10. Stir in brown butter. If risotto is too soupy, cook for a few minutes longer, stirring, until it begins to thicken more; it should look like a smooth, creamy sauce.

query: What should I do with the mushrooms after they have soaked?
text: Relevant Information: cup Information Type: equipment Instruction: In a small heatproof bowl or measuring cup, soak mushrooms in boiling water until fully softened, about 20 minutes. Step: 1. In a small heatproof bowl or measuring cup, soak mushrooms in boiling water until fully softened, about 20 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove mushrooms from soaking liquid and squeeze out excess moisture back into the bowl or measuring cup. Reserve rehydrated mushrooms and 1/4 cup (60ml) soaking liquid, making sure to dispose of any grit that has settled at the bottom.

query: what am I preheating the oven to?
text: Relevant Information: Preheat oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Step: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

query: what am I preheating the oven to? to 400°f How should I prepare the squash for this step?
text: Relevant Information: Preheat oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Step: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

query: what am I preheating the oven to? to 400°f How should I prepare the squash for this step? Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash?
text: Relevant Information: 3 1/2 pounds squash Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Step: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. text: Relevant Information: separate bowl Information Type: equipment Instruction: In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet. Step: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. query: How do I handle the mushroom after soaking it?

query: How should I prepare the quail for cooking?
text: Relevant Information: 4 whole quail Information Type: ingredient Instruction: If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). Step: 1. Season quail all over with salt. In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add quail. If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). If using deboned quail, cook on both sides, turning frequently, until browned on both sides and desired doneness is reach, about 4 minutes per side for medium.

query: How should I prepare the quail for cooking? Season quail all over with salt. When should I add the quail to the skillet?
text: Relevant Information: large cast iron skillet Information Type: equipment Instruction: In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Step: 1. Season quail all over with salt. In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add quail. If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). If using deboned quail, cook on both sides, turning frequently, until browned on both sides and desired doneness is reach, about 4 minutes per side for medium.

text: Relevant Information: pan Information Type: equipment Instruction: Using clean hands, arrange apple slices in prepared loaf pan in an overlapping pattern, making sure that flat sides of the apples are flush with the edges of pan (as you work, reserve some of the largest, nicest apple slices for the top layer; you'll need roughly 40 to 50 slices for it). Step: 8. Using clean hands, arrange apple slices in prepared loaf pan in an overlapping pattern, making sure that flat sides of the apples are flush with the edges of pan (as you work, reserve some of the largest, nicest apple slices for the top layer; you'll need roughly 40 to 50 slices for it). Continue arranging apples in even layers until apples are 1/2 inch from top; press apples down to evenly distribute.

text: Relevant Information: 75 minutes Information Type: time Instruction: Bake until top is golden brown and domed and a cake tester or toothpick inserted into the center meets little resistance and comes out clean, 65 to 75 minutes; rotate pan one time halfway through baking. Step: 11. Set loaf pan on middle rack of oven and slide a rimmed baking sheet on the rack underneath to catch any drips. Bake until top is golden brown and domed and a cake tester or toothpick inserted into the center meets little resistance and comes out clean, 65 to 75 minutes; rotate pan one time halfway through baking. Transfer cake to wire rack and cool for 10 minutes; loosen sides with butter knife or offset spatula. Cool cake in pan to about 140°F (60°C), about 2 hours. Then lift loaf using overhanging parchment and transfer to a cutting board. Let cake cool completely before slicing, about 1 hour longer.

Coat bottom and sides; carefully tap out excess flour. which ingredients do I need to dust the pan with? flour what temperature do I need to put the oven on.? 190°c what ingredients do I need? flour and baking powder what do I have to put the ingredients inside? bowl How can I make the flour and baking powder blend well together? whisk flour and baking powder until well combined, at least 30 seconds what do I put the ingredients inside? small bowl, whisk Alexa what size for the container and also what other tools do I need to use? medium bowl, whisk How should I mix the miso and butter together? whisk miso and butter until miso is broken up which ingredient do I need to add to the Bowl? miso and butter how many seconds do I need to whisk this for? about 30 seconds What should I do after whisking in the milk? set aside. Alexa what must I put the ingredients inside? bowl Done. What's next? (Alternatively, beat eggs and sugar in a large mixing bowl using an electric handheld mixer or a whisk, about 90 seconds for the electric mixer and 2 minutes for the whisk.) which Electric Appliance do I need to use to mix ingredients? electric handheld mixer what do I need to use to mix the ingredients? electric handheld mixer or a whisk which ingredient do I need to use a knot to the bow? flour How will I know when I have whisked enough? until no lumps remain. what is it that I need to whisk in? mixture what do I need to stir the apples? large rubber spatula which fruits do I need to add? apples what else do I need to stir these ingredients? wooden spoon How can I ensure the apples are homogeneously distributed in the batter? stir apples into batter until evenly coated. How should I incorporate the apples into the batter? Using a large rubber spatula or wooden spoon, stir apples into batter. which fruits do I need? apples where do I put these ingredients? pan What should I consider while arranging the apple slices? Reserve some of the largest, nicest apple slices for the top layer; you'll need roughly 40 to 50 slices for it. Continue arranging apples in even layers until apples are 1/2 inch from top; press apples down to evenly distribute. What does it mean to arrange apples in a shingled pattern? <no_answer> How should I arrange the apples? Arrange final layer of apples in horizontal, shingled pattern. where do I put ingredients Alexa? pan What do I do with the remaining batter? Scrape remaining batter into pan, making sure to leave 1/4 inch space from top. How do I prevent air pockets in the batter? Gently tap pan to knock out air pockets and distribute batter. How should I prepare the pan before baking the cake? Set loaf pan on middle rack of oven and slide a rimmed baking sheet on the rack underneath to catch any drips. how long do I need to bake this for? for 10 minutes what temperature do I need to set the oven at? 140°f what is the one ingredient that I need to use to the mixture? water What are the steps to prepare the caramel? In a 3-quart stainless steel saucier, combine water and sugar over medium heat. Stir with a fork until syrup comes to a boil, about 4 minutes, then simmer without stirring until syrup is honey-colored, roughly 5 minutes, shaking and swirling as needed to ensure even caramelization. Continue cooking until syrup is light to medium amber, about 1 minute longer. How can I achieve even caramelization? Shaking and swirling as needed to ensure even caramelization. After boiling the syrup, what do I need to do with it? Simmer without stirring until syrup is honey-colored, roughly 5 minutes, shaking and swirling as needed to ensure even caramelization. Continue cooking until syrup is light to medium amber, about 1 minute longer. how long do I need to do this process for? 5 minutes how many minutes? about 1 minute What is the first thing I have to do in this step? Immediately add cream what temperature do I need to reduce the heat down to? reduce heat to medium-low which ingredient do I need to use? cream what temperature do I use? 225°f which tool do I need to use to stir the mixture? heat-resistant spatula which heat do I need to set the temperature to? 107°c What is the best technique to mix in miso off heat? <extra_id_0> Relevant Information: heat, whisk Information Type: equipment Instruction: Off heat, whisk in miso until smooth and combined. Step: 15. Off heat, whisk in miso until smooth and combined. Transfer sauce to a heat-safe container.

text: Relevant Information: 1 quart stock Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Place stock in a large liquid measuring cup and sprinkle gelatin over the top. Step: 2. Adjust oven rack to lower-middle position and preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Place stock in a large liquid measuring cup and sprinkle gelatin over the top. Set aside. Heat duck fat (if using) in a large Dutch oven over high heat until shimmering. Add salt pork and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned all over, about 8 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a large bowl, leaving rendered fat in Dutch oven, and set aside. (If not using duck fat, cook pork with no additional fat.)

query: what it will be in degrees Centigrade?
text: Relevant Information: Preheat oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Step: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash? toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt. Toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt. What should I do after cutting the squash? In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet. What is the indication that the squash trays are completely baked? Large chunks are very tender, about 45 minutes, and small diced squash is browned in spots, about 30 minutes. how long should I bake until chunks are tender? about 45 minutes how long should I cook untill a small dice squash is browned?
text: Relevant Information: 3 1/2 pounds squash Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Bake both trays of squash, stirring once or twice during baking, until large chunks are very tender, about 45 minutes, and small diced squash is browned in spots, about 30 minutes. Step: 2. Bake both trays of squash, stirring once or twice during baking, until large chunks are very tender, about 45 minutes, and small diced squash is browned in spots, about 30 minutes. Discard sage sprigs from large squash chunks.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast?
text: Relevant Information: fresh yeast Information Type: ingredient Instruction: If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. Step: 1. If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. If using active dry yeast, combine flour with 650g water and combine yeast with 50g warm water; let yeast stand until foamy. Mix flour and water at low speed until they are fully incorporated and form a uniform dough. Alternatively, combine flour and water in a mixing bowl and mix using a dough spatula until dough forms. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let the dough rest for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast? If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. what else do I mix in with the yeast? flour and all of the water what type of raising agent is best? fresh yeast How should I mix these (salt and yeast) ingredients into the dough? Mix at low speed or by hand until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth. How can I determine if the dough is ready for the next step? Until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth. do I need any seasoning? salt do I mix it by hand? mixer how long do I have to mix everything for? about 3-5 minutes What is the indication that the dough has been adequately mixed? the dough feels elastic and bounces partway back when indented with your thumb What should I do after I transfer the dough to the mixing bowl?
text: Relevant Information: mixing bowl Information Type: equipment Instruction: Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough, being careful not to tear its surface, to a lightly oiled mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Step: 4. Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough, being careful not to tear its surface, to a lightly oiled mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let dough stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Uncover dough. Working with wet hands and/or a plastic bench scraper, loosen the dough, then gently lift and pull the dough down towards you, folding it in half. Give the bowl a quarter turn and repeat, folding the dough in half towards you. Now give the bowl a half turn and repeat the fold a final time, being careful not to compress it too much. Lastly, pull the unfolded side of your dough carefully up from the bottom, and pull it up and over to form a neat package. Re-cover with plastic wrap and let stand until dough has increased in volume by half, about 1 hour 30 minutes longer.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast? If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. what else do I mix in with the yeast?
text: Relevant Information: stand mixer Information Type: equipment Instruction: If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. Step: 1. If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. If using active dry yeast, combine flour with 650g water and combine yeast with 50g warm water; let yeast stand until foamy. Mix flour and water at low speed until they are fully incorporated and form a uniform dough. Alternatively, combine flour and water in a mixing bowl and mix using a dough spatula until dough forms. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let the dough rest for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.

text: Relevant Information: dough Information Type: ingredient Instruction: With a spray bottle filled with water, lightly spritz the surface of the dough. Step: 8. Remove 1 loaf from the refrigerator and gently turn it out, seam-side down, into the preheated Dutch oven. With a razor or paring knife, score the full surface of the dough with 2 parallel lines roughly 3 inches apart. With a spray bottle filled with water, lightly spritz the surface of the dough.
